com.guidewire.pl.plugin.geocode

Interface GeocodePlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPlugin, IStartablePlugin
    Deprecated. 
    External entities are deprecated. Please use the new Java API instead.

    @Deprecated
public interface GeocodePlugin
extends IStartablePlugin

    • Method Detail

      • geocodeAddressBestMatch

        Address geocodeAddressBestMatch(Address address)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Synchronously geocode an Address. A new address entity will be returned containing either a GeocodeStatus of Failure (if Geocoding did not succeed) or a GeocodeStatus indicating Success (exact, postalcode or city) plus the best matching latitude and longitude. If a network or transient error occurs, an exception must be thrown. If corrections are supported (indicated by pluginSupportsCorrections() returns true) the non-geocode fields of the returned address must be set by plugin to reflect the actual address used for the best match latitude and longitude. If corrections are not supported, (indicated by pluginSupportsCorrections() returns false) the non-geocode fields of the returned address must be set to the value to be displayed as the "actual serach center used" (although they will not be logged to the database as corrections); as a general recommendation these should be a copy of the original fields on the address provided for geocoding.
        Parameters:
        address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. This address must not be modified by the method.
        Returns:
        a new address containing the geocodes found and the actual search center used; if corrections are supported, this must be the corrected address.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • geocodeAddressWithCorrections

        java.util.List geocodeAddressWithCorrections(Address address)
                                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Synchronously geocode an Address, returning a list of addresses which could match the provided address. The first result in the list is used as the best match found.
        Parameters:
        address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. This address must not be modified by the method.
        Returns:
        A list of addresses. If the geocoding service supports multiple corrections, the first result returned should be the best match available, and should match the Latitude and Longitude set on the original If the geocoding service does not support multiple corrections, this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to geocodeAddressBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this default behavior.)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • geocodeAddressWithCorrections

        java.util.List geocodeAddressWithCorrections(Address address,
                                           int maxResults)
                                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Synchronously geocode an Address, returning a list of addresses which could match the provided address. The first result in the list is used as the best match found. This caps the number of results found.
        Parameters:
        address - an Address object, to be Geocoded. This address must not be modified by the method.
        maxResults - the maximum number of results to return, if a positive/non-zero integer. Returns all results if zero or negative.
        Returns:
        A list of addresses. If the geocoding service supports multiple corrections, the first result returned should be the best match available, and should match the Latitude and Longitude set on the original If the geocoding service does not support multiple corrections, this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to geocodeAddressBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this behavior.)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAddressByGeocode

        java.util.List getAddressByGeocode(java.math.BigDecimal latitude,
                                 java.math.BigDecimal longitude)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieves from the external Geocoding service the list of possible addresses located at the Geocode (latitude/longitude pair) provided. By default, AbstractGeocodePlugin will wrap the return value of getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch in a singleton list. If this method is implemented, pluginSupportsFindByGeocode() and pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() should both return true. If finding by geocode is not supported, this must return one of: null, an empty list or a list containing a single null element.
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        Returns:
        A list of addresses, with geocode fields filled out, or null if no matches found. The first result returned should be the best match available, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.) If the geocoding service does not support multiple matches (pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() returns true), this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch (AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this behavior.) If finding by geocode is not supported, this must return null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAddressByGeocode

        java.util.List getAddressByGeocode(java.math.BigDecimal latitude,
                                 java.math.BigDecimal longitude,
                                 int maxResults)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieves from the external Geocoding service the list of possible addresses located at the Geocode (latitude/longitude pair) provided. This caps the number of results found. By default, AbstractGeocodePlugin will wrap the return value of getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch in a singleton list. If this method is implemented, pluginSupportsFindByGeocode() and pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() should both return true. If finding by geocode is not supported, this must return one of: null, an empty list or a list containing a single null element.
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        maxResults - the maximum number of results to return, if a positive/non-zero integer. Returns all results if zero or negative.
        Returns:
        A list of addresses, with geocode fields filled out, or null if no matches found. The first result returned should be the best match available, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.) If the geocoding service does not support multiple matches (pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple() returns true), this should be a singleton List containing the results of a call to getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch

        Address getAddressByGeocodeBestMatch(java.math.BigDecimal latitude,
                                   java.math.BigDecimal longitude)
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieves from the external Geocoding service that address which is the best match for the Geocode (latitude/longitude pair) provided. If this method is implemented, pluginSupportsFindByGeocode() should return true. If finding by geocode is not supported, this must null. AbstractGeocodePlugin implements this as "unimplemented" by returning null.
        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        Returns:
        An address providing the best match available for the provided Latitude and Longitude, or null if either no match was found, or this is not supported, and should have its geocode fields filled out (if no more precise geocodes are available, this can be the provided Latitude and Longitude.).
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getDrivingDirections

        DrivingDirections getDrivingDirections(Address startAddress,
                                     Address finishAddress,
                                     UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Gets driving directions, driving time and a map illustrating the route between the two addresses. If the remote provider does not support any of these features, just return null. If the remote provider does not support some of these features, that data on the DrivingDirections object should be left as null.
        Parameters:
        startAddress - The start address
        finishAddress - The finish address
        unitOfDistance - a unit of distance object indicating whether the directions should be in Metric or US/Imperial units.
        Returns:
        a DrivingDirections object, or null if directions are not supported.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getMapForAddress

        MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address,
                           UnitOfDistance unit)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a URL to a map showing the address provided. If not supported, returns null.
        Parameters:
        address -
        unit -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getMapForAddress

        MapImageUrl getMapForAddress(Address address,
                           UnitOfDistance unit,
                           java.lang.String options)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a URL to a map showing the address provided. If not supported, returns null. Note that "options" is an opaque string; this is only useful if passed to a KNOWN plugin implementation. Plugins should ignore unknown options.
        Parameters:
        address -
        unit -
        options -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode

        boolean isSufficientlyCompleteToGeocode(Address address)
        Deprecated. 
        Checks if the address to see if it has sufficiently complete information to Geocode it, without checking the Geocoding service.
        Parameters:
        address - the address to check for sufficient information
        Returns:
        true, if the address contains sufficient information

      • pluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections

        boolean pluginReturnsOverviewMapWithDrivingDirections()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin returns an overview map with the driving directions

      • pluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections

        boolean pluginReturnsStepByStepMapsWithDrivingDirections()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin returns a set of step-by-step maps with the driving directions

      • pluginSupportsCorrections

        boolean pluginSupportsCorrections()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin returns a corrected address with geocodeAddressBestMatch; if it does not, it should return a copy of the provided address.

      • pluginSupportsDrivingDirections

        boolean pluginSupportsDrivingDirections()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports calls to getDrivingDirections.

      • pluginSupportsFindByGeocode

        boolean pluginSupportsFindByGeocode()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports generating a best-match address from a given Latitude/Longitude pair.

      • pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple

        boolean pluginSupportsFindByGeocodeMultiple()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports generating a list of potential-match addresses from a given Latitude/Longitude pair.

      • pluginSupportsMappingByAddress

        boolean pluginSupportsMappingByAddress()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports calls to getMapForAddress (to get a non-route map)

      • pluginSupportsMultipleCorrections

        boolean pluginSupportsMultipleCorrections()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns:
        true, if the plugin supports returning multiple corrected addresses when geocodeAddressWithCorrections; if false, the return type of geocodeAddressWithCorrections should be a singleton list containing the results of a call to geocodeAddressBestMatch
